intro: Nassauvia purpurascens, commonly known as the purplestem false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Nassauvia purpurascens is a perennial shrub that plays a role in stabilizing soil in arid regions.
